  "document_summary": "This issue of the official gazette, 'Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm', dated August 17, 2025, comprehensively details a wide range of governmental and judicial activities in Kuwait. Key contents include numerous decree-laws approving the final financial accounts for various public authorities and institutions for the fiscal year 2024/2025. It also features several decrees concerning ministerial appointments, resignations, and the withdrawal of Kuwaiti nationality from a significant number of individuals. The gazette publishes ministerial decisions on diverse topics such as drug price reductions, energy efficiency regulations, amendments to insurance laws, and the closure of industrial plots due to violations. Furthermore, it contains extensive announcements for public tenders from various ministries and public authorities for a multitude of services, supplies, and infrastructure projects, alongside commercial announcements regarding company liquidations, agency registrations, and commercial license transfers. Resolution No. (10) of 2020
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Resolution No. (1) of 2019
Regarding the regulation of company registration procedures

The Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
Having reviewed Law No. (1) of 2010 regarding the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
And Law No. (1) of 2019 regarding Companies,
And Resolution No. (1) of 2019 regarding the regulation of company registration procedures,
And upon the approval of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> at its meeting No. (10) of 2020 dated 15/11/2020,
And as required by the interest of work,
Has resolved:

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
Article (1)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall undertake the registration of companies in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, and for that purpose, it shall have all powers stipulated for the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in this regard.

<table>
| No. | Description                                     |
| :-- | :---------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Company Registration Application                |
| 2   | Company Memorandum of Association               |
| 3   | Company Articles of Association                 |
| 4   | Capital Deposit Certificate                     |
| 5   | Copy of Civil ID for Founders                   |
| 6   | Copy of Passport for Non-Kuwaiti Founders       |
| 7   | Bank Certificate confirming Capital Deposit     |
| 8   | Any other documents requested by the Authority  |
</table>

Article (2)
The following Article (2) shall be added to Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, with the following text:
Article (2)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall be committed to registering companies within a period not exceeding (3) working days from the date of completion of all required documents, after payment of the prescribed fees.

Article (3)
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
Sheikh Dr. / Mishaal Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>

# Council of Ministers
## Decree-Law No. 92 of 2025
**Regarding the Approval of the Final Account of the Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport <orig>الهيئة العامة للطرق والنقل البري</orig> for the Fiscal Year 2024/2025**

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the rules for preparing public budgets, controlling their implementation, and the final account, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (115) of 2014 regarding the establishment of the Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport <orig>الهيئة العامة للطرق والنقل البري</orig>, amended by Law No. (3) of 2015,
- And Decree-Law No. (37) of 2024 linking the budget of the Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport <orig>الهيئة العامة للطرق والنقل البري</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law: -

### Article One
The final account of the Public Authority for Roads and Land Transport <orig>الهيئة العامة للطرق والنقل البري</orig> for the fiscal year 2024/2025 is hereby approved as follows: -
a. Revenues amounted to K.D. 14,980.729 (Fourteen thousand, nine hundred and eighty Kuwaiti Dinars and 729 fils only) in accordance with Table (A) attached to this Decree-Law.
b. Expenditures amounted to K.D. 1,084,442.652 (One million, eighty-four thousand, four hundred and forty-two Kuwaiti Dinars and 652 fils only) in accordance with Table (B) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Two
The losses resulting from the excess of expenditures over revenues, amounting to K.D. 1,069,461.923 (One million, sixty-nine thousand, four hundred and sixty-one Kuwaiti Dinars and 923 fils only), in accordance with Table (C) attached to this Decree-Law, shall be carried forward as accumulated losses within the capital of the Authority funded by the State's general budget.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية بالوكالة</orig>
Dr. Subaih Abdulaziz Abdulmohsen Al-Mukhaizim <orig>صبيح عبدالعزيز عبدالمحسن المخيزم</orig>
Issued at Seif Palace on: 16 Safar 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 10 August 2025 AD

Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>
Ahmed Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>

(Two hundred thirty-three million, eighty-seven thousand, forty-four Kuwaiti Dinars and 171 fils only), shall be added, after deducting the share of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare / Al-Mu'assasa Al-Amma Lil-Ri'aya Al-Sakaniya <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> according to the progressive ascending tranches, to the General Reserve Account of the Fund, in accordance with the following distribution:

2- 208,969,635.337 K.D. shall be transferred to the General Reserve of the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development / Al-Sunduq Al-Kuwaiti Lil-Tanmiya Al-Iqtisadiya Al-Arabiya <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig>.
This is in accordance with Schedule (C) attached to this Decree-Law.

### Article Three
The Prime Minister / Ra'is Majlis Al-Wuzara' <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Decree No. 151 of 2025
## Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship
### From Certain Individuals

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And the Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,

We have decreed the following:

**Article One**

Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from those listed below and from those who may have acquired it through them by dependency:

1.  Shaima Abdulhadi Majeed Dhaidan <orig>شيماء عبدالهادي مجيد ضيدان</orig>
2.  Fahad Abdulhadi Majeed Dhaidan <orig>فهد عبدالهادي مجيد ضيدان</orig>
3.  Marzouq Saeed Awad Al-Enezi <orig>مرزوق سعيد عواد العنزي</orig>
4.  Habib Kayed Baniya Al-Enezi <orig>حبيب كايد بنيه العنزي</orig>
5.  Matar Nafea Salem Al-Enezi <orig>مطر نافع سالم العنزي</orig>
6.  Hadi Taha Qabeel Al-Enezi <orig>هادي طه قبيل العنزي</orig>
7.  Salem Hajar Hailan Al-Enezi <orig>سالم حجر هيلان العنزي</orig>
8.  Shaher Dhahi Shaher Al-Enezi <orig>شاهر ضاحي شاهر العنزي</orig>
9.  Obaid Fahad Mohammed Mayouf Al-Enezi <orig>عبيد فهد محمد معيوف العنزي</orig>
10. Fahhad Fahad Mohammed Mayouf Al-Enezi <orig>فهاد فهد محمد معيوف العنزي</orig>
11. Mohammed Abdullah Mohammed Omar Al-Enezi <orig>محمد عبدالله محمد عمر العنزي</orig>
12. Ahmed Abdullah Mohammed Omar Al-Enezi <orig>احمد عبدالله محمد عمر العنزي</orig>

# Decree No. 154 of 2025
## Regarding the Appointment of Two Assistant Undersecretaries in the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>

- Having reviewed the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>,
- And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhul-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Decree-Law No. 15 of 1979 regarding Civil Service <orig>الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And the Decree issued on 7 Jumada Al-Ula 1399 AH corresponding to 4 April 1979 AD regarding the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Education <orig>وزير التربية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
The following individuals are appointed to the rank of Assistant Undersecretary <orig>وكيل وزارة مساعد</orig> in the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>:
1. Mohammed Ghalib Hunaibel Al-Khalidi <orig>محمد غالب حنيبل الخالدي</orig>.
2. Hamad Abdullah Hamad Al-Hamad <orig>حمد عبدالله حمد الحمد</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Education <orig>وزير التربية</orig> shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>
**Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>**

Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>
**Ahmed Abdullah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>أحمد عبد الله الأحمد الصباح</orig>**

Acting Minister of Education <orig>وزير التربية بالنيابة</orig>
**Dr. Nader Abdullah Mohammed Al-Jalal <orig>د. نادر عبدالله محمد الجلال</orig>**

Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 16 Safar 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 10 August 2025 AD
<page_end>38</page_end>

# Decree No. 155 of 2025
## Regarding the Transfer of an Ambassador from the Diwan to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And upon the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhul-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And upon Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System <orig>نظام السلكين الدبلوماسي والقنصلي</orig> and its amending laws,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Ambassador Thamer Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>ثامر جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> to the Kingdom of Bahrain <orig>مملكة البحرين</orig> - shall be transferred to the General Diwan of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>ديوان عام وزارة الخارجية</orig>.

### Article Two
The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this Decree, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Amir of Kuwait <orig>أمير الكويت</orig>

# Council of Ministers Resolution
## No. 1000 of 2025
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship Certificate
### From Certain Individuals

The Council of Ministers
- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Article (21 bis "a") of Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 concerning the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Acting Minister of Interior,
Has resolved
### Article One
The Kuwaiti citizenship certificate shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below, and Kuwaiti nationality shall be withdrawn from anyone who acquired it through dependency on the holder of that certificate:
1- Falah Assaf Hussein Mohammed Hussein Zamanan Al-Ajmi <orig>فلاح عساف حسين محمد حسين زمانان العجمي</orig>.
2- Owaid Manahi Ayed Shtran Al-Ajmi <orig>عويض مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
3- Nasser Manahi Ayed Shtran Al-Ajmi <orig>ناصر مناحي عايض شتران العجمي</orig>.
4- Hamoud Dheeb Nasser Jehan Al-Hajri <orig>حمود ذيب ناصر جيهان الهاجري</orig>.
5- Nayef Dheeb Nasser Jehan Al-Hajri <orig>نايف ذيب ناصر جيهان الهاجري</orig>.
6- Qablan Hadi Saeed Khader Al-Ajmi <orig>قبلان هادي سعيد خضر العجمي</orig>.
### Article Two
The Minister of Interior shall implement this resolution, which shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.
Acting Prime Minister
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

# Decision
**Article One**
The text of Article Two of Ministerial Decision No. (180) of 2020 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم (180) لسنة 2020</orig> referred to above shall be replaced with the following text:
## Article (2)
"Kuwaiti accountants registered and practicing the profession in the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> may establish professional companies for accounting services <orig>شركات مهنية للخدمات المحاسبية</orig>, to practice activities such as bookkeeping, preparing financial statements, financial and accounting consultations, conducting inventory operations and stock control, asset valuation <orig>تقوم الأصول</orig>, internal auditing, and liquidation work, after submitting a certificate from the Association <orig>الجمعية</orig>.
Similarly, Kuwaiti auditors registered and practicing the profession in the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> may establish professional companies for auditing accounts <orig>شركات مهنية لمراقبة الحسابات</orig>, to practice activities such as account review and auditing, review and auditing for preparing tax financial statements <orig>كشوف الذمة المالية للضريبة</orig>, asset valuation <orig>تقوم الأصول</orig>, and liquidation work, after submitting a certificate from the Association <orig>الجمعية</orig>.
The activities of asset valuation <orig>تقوم الأصول</orig> and investment advisor <orig>مستشار استثمار</orig> may not be practiced except after obtaining a license from the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> specifying the licensed activity or activities.
Only financial consulting companies <orig>شركات الاستشارات المالية</orig> are exempt from the supervision of the Association <orig>الجمعية</orig> and the requirement to obtain its approval.
Commercial companies may not be established to provide accounting services, auditing work, or financial or accounting consultations."
**Article Two**
All officials - each within their jurisdiction - shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

# (Ministerial Decision No. 1398 of 2025 <orig>قرار وزاري رقم 1398 لسنة 2025</orig>)
## Regarding: Amendment of some provisions of Ministerial Decision No.
## 81 of 1976 <orig>1976/81</orig>
## concerning the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments

First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior
- Having reviewed Decree-Law No. 67 of 1976 <orig>المرسوم بقانون رقم 1976/67</orig> concerning Traffic and its amendments.
- And Ministerial Decision No. 81 of 1976 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 1976/81</orig> concerning the Executive Regulations of the Traffic Law and its amendments.
- And the letter from the General Traffic Department <orig>الإدارة العامة للمرور</orig> No. 280755 dated 5/8/2025 and its attachments.
- And based on the recommendation of the Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry.
Has decided
### Article (First)
The text of Article (46 bis) of the aforementioned Ministerial Decision No. 81 of 1976 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 76/81</orig> shall be replaced with the following text:
Tinted glass may be installed according to manufacturer specifications for all types of vehicles. Tinted films may also be installed, provided that the tinting of the colored films does not exceed (50%). All windows may be tinted except for the front windshield (opposite the driver), which must be of a transparent, safe type according to Gulf standard specifications. The installation of reflective glass or films is prohibited.
### (Article Second)
The Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister
and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Those concerned shall implement this decision, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Acting Undersecretary of the Ministry of Interior <orig>وكيل وزارة الداخلية بالتكليف</orig>
Major General
Ali Misfer Al-Adwani <orig>علي مسفر العدواني</orig>

Issued on: 12 Safar 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 6 August 2025 AD
# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (189) of 2025
### Regarding the Reduction of the List of Prices for Medicines and Pharmaceutical Preparations in the State of Kuwait

**Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>:**
- Having reviewed the provisions of the two Decree-Laws and the Civil Service System <orig>نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and their amendments,
- And the provisions of Law No. 28 of 1996 regarding the regulation of the pharmacy profession <orig>تنظيم مهنة الصيدلة</orig>,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 238 of 1992 regarding the determination of medicine prices,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 232 of 2015 regarding the study and fixing of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 16 of 2021 regarding the adoption of the mechanism for pricing medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 58 of 2023 regarding the pricing of medicines, pharmaceutical preparations, and nutritional supplements in the private sector,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 74 of 2023 regarding the determination of prices for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Administrative Decision No. 8367 of 2022 regarding the fixing of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And based on the recommendation of the Drug Pricing Committee <orig>لجنة تسعير الأدوية</orig> formed by Ministerial Decision No. 117 of 2018, convened on 10 August 2025,
- And based on the requirements of public interest, and what the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> presented to us.
<page_end>44</page_end>

**Decided -**

**Article One:**
The regulation for reducing the prices of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations is adopted in the attached price list, totaling 400 items, which begins with the medicine Aclasta 0.05mg/ml Solution for Infusion (100ml) and ends with the medicine Zoledro-Denk 4mg/5ml Concentrate for Solution for Infusion (5ml Vial), and is added to Ministerial Resolution No. 74 of 2023.

**Article Two:**
This decision shall be communicated to those concerned for its implementation, and any decision or text conflicting with it shall be revoked. It shall come into effect three months after the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

**Minister of Health**

- Decided -

**Article One:**
The prices of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations in the attached price list, totaling 144 items, starting with the medicine 50%w/v Dextrose IV Injection (50ml Glass Vial), are approved, and Z-Onda 2mg/ml Solution for Injection (4ml) is added to Ministerial Resolution No. 74 of 2023.

**Article Two:**
This decision shall be communicated to those concerned for its implementation, and any decision or text conflicting with it shall be revoked. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Health
Dr. Ahmed Abdul Wahab Al-Awadhi <orig>أحمد عبد الوهاب العوضي</orig>

Corresponding to: 17 Safar 1447 AH

STATE OF KUWAIT

  "page_summary": "This page contains Ministerial Decision No. (2025/19) from the Public Authority for Industry, adopting two mandatory Kuwaiti technical regulations (KWS 1902-1:2024 and KWS 1902-2:2024) for energy efficiency, functionality, and labelling requirements for lighting products, and outlines the implementation details."

</header>

- And on Law No. 56 of 1996 concerning the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- And on Decree-Law No. 128 of 1977 concerning Standardization <orig>التوحيد القياسي</orig>.
- And on Decree No. 191 of 2015 concerning the organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
- And on the internal regulations approved by the Ministerial Committee for Standardization Affairs <orig>اللجنة الوزارية لشؤون التقيس</orig> on November 14, 2019, which supersede the Statute of the GCC Standardization Organization <orig>هيئة التقيس لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>.
- And on the relevant ministerial decisions regarding the adoption of Kuwaiti technical regulations and standard specifications.
- And on Recommendation No. 6 contained in the minutes of the tenth meeting of the Sectoral Committee for Electrical and Electronic Specifications <orig>اللجنة القطاع للمواصفات الكهربائية والإلكترونية</orig> held on June 25, 2023.
- And on the decision of the General Standardization Committee <orig>اللجنة العامة للتوحيد القياسي</orig> at its seventy-first meeting held on December 10, 2023.
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>.
- And based on what the public interest dictates.

### Article One
Two Kuwaiti technical regulations (mandatory), detailed in the appendix to this decision, shall be considered as such.

### Article Two
Compliance with registering lighting products covered by the technical regulations appended to this decision in the Public Authority for Industry's <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> system for registration and issuance of an energy efficiency label bearing a single serial number for each model, to be printed on the product packaging in accordance with the requirements of the relevant regulation.

### Article Three
The provisions of Decision No. (93) of (2024) concerning the adoption of two Kuwaiti technical regulations related to energy efficiency requirements, operational requirements, and labeling for lighting products - Part One and Part Two (mandatory) shall be revoked, and all decisions that contradict the provisions of this decision shall also be revoked.

### Article Four
All officials, each within their respective jurisdiction, shall implement this decision, which shall come into effect one year from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

Issued on: July 31, 2025 AD

*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   Violation report submitted by the Engineering Services Department No. (D-11) dated 3/11/2024, stating that / Jawharat Al-Khareenj General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة جوهرة الخرينج للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> committed the following violation:
    *   Exploiting the site without legal title, leasing the site, and erecting a brick fence around the site.
*   Recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (2025/3/497) held on 28/1/2025.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
*   And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided
(Article One)
To close / Plot No. (4A) located in South Amghara <orig>جنوب امغرة</orig> area – Block (1) – until the violations and their consequences are removed.
(Article Two)
In the event of failure to remove the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
(Article Three)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from its date of issuance, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
Issued on: August 3, 2025 AD

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Resolution No. PAI (187) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   Violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A1-263) dated 30/12/2024, stating that / Al-Sindan Blacksmith Works Factory <orig>مصنع السندان لأعمال الحدادة</orig> committed the following violations:
    *   Making changes to the capacity, size, and purpose of the industrial activity.
    *   Engaging in commercial activities without an industrial license.

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed: -
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 <orig>القانون رقم (56) لسنة 1996</orig> regarding the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig> and their amendments.

*   The violation report <orig>محضر ضبط المخالفة</orig> submitted by the Engineering Services Department <orig>قسم الخدمات الهندسية</orig> No. (D 10-) <orig>D 10-</orig>, dated 2024/11/3, stating that Mr. Falah Suwaid Faraj Al-Saidi <orig>فلاح سويد فراج السعيدي</orig> committed the following violation:

*   And based on what was presented by Mr. Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has resolved
(Article One)
To issue a warning to Mr. Falah Suwaid Faraj Al-Saidi <orig>فلاح سويد فراج السعيدي</orig>.
Located in South Amghara <orig>جنوب أمغرة</orig> area - Plot (1) <orig>قطعة (1)</orig> - Parcel (A3) <orig>قسيمة (A3)</orig>, requiring the removal of the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (one month). In case of failure to remove the violation, stricter measures will be taken in accordance with the applicable rules in this regard.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Decision No. (151) of 2025
Regarding a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme established outside the State of Kuwait, granted to Ammar Finance and Leasing Company <orig>شركة عمار للتمويل والإجارة</orig> to market shares of Eagle India Investments Sharia Fund 1 Limited <orig>صندوق ايجل انديا انفستمنتس شريعة فاند 1 ليمتد</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Bylaws of Ammar Finance and Leasing Company <orig>شركة عمار للتمويل والإجارة</orig>;
- The agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, Eagle India Investments Limited <orig>إيجل انديا انفستمنتس ليمتد</orig>, and the marketing manager, Ammar Finance and Leasing Company <orig>شركة عمار للتمويل والإجارة</orig>;
- The request from Ammar Finance and Leasing Company <orig>شركة عمار للتمويل والإجارة</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of Eagle India Investments Sharia Fund 1 Limited <orig>صندوق ايجل انديا انفستمنتس شريعة فاند 1 ليمتد</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has decided the following:
### Article One

### Article Two

### Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

The marketing license duration is one year, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

# Resolution No. (154) of 2025
## Regarding a Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait Granted to National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> for Marketing Shares of Al-Ijara and Finance Forty-Fourth Limited Fund <orig>صندوق الإجارة والتمويل الرابع والأربعون المحدود</orig>

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Bylaws of National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, Intervest L.P. <orig>إنتر فست إل بي</orig>, and the marketing manager, National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>;
- The request from National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of Al-Ijara and Finance Forty-Fourth Limited Fund <orig>صندوق الإجارة والتمويل الرابع والأربعون المحدود</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 2025/01/12.

**Has resolved the following:**
## Article One
National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 18,000,000 shares (eighteen million shares only) of Al-Ijara and Finance Forty-Fourth Limited Fund <orig>صندوق الإجارة والتمويل الرابع والأربعون المحدود</orig> within the State of Kuwait, which is established in the Cayman Islands. The offer price shall be 10 US Dollars (ten US Dollars only) per share, in addition to a subscription commission of up to 2.25% of the invested amount, payable once upon subscription.

## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered only to professional clients as per the text contained in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and their amendments. The entities receiving subscription requests shall be:
- National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig>.
- National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

## Article Four
The marketing license duration is one year, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this resolution. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the resolution shall be deemed null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its respective jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

# Decision No. (158) of 2025
Regarding
a private marketing license for a collective investment scheme <orig>نظام استثمار جماعي</orig> established outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> granted to Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> for marketing shares of MKZ Development 60 Company <orig>شركة إم كي زي ديفيلوبمنت 60</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities <orig>نشاط الأوراق المالية</orig>, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>, and the agreement concluded between the collective investment scheme <orig>نظام الاستثمار الجماعي</orig> Markaz Investment Advisors Limited <orig>مركز انفستمنت أدفايزرز ليمتد</orig> and Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>;
- The request from Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> to undertake the private marketing of shares of MKZ Development 60 Company <orig>شركة إم كي زي ديفيلوبمنت 60</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 2025/01/12.
decided the following:
## Article One
Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig> is licensed to market 45,000 shares (only forty-five thousand shares) of MKZ Development 60 Company <orig>شركة إم كي زي ديفيلوبمنت 60</orig> (MKZ Development 60) through private placement within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, established in the Cayman Islands <orig>جزر الكايمان</orig>. The offer price shall be 1,000 US Dollars (only one thousand US Dollars) per share.
## Article Two
The shares to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients <orig>العملاء المحترفين</orig> only, as per the text contained in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities <orig>نشاط الأوراق المالية</orig> and their amendments. The entity receiving subscription applications shall be:
- Kuwait Financial Centre Company <orig>شركة المركز المالي الكويتي</orig>.
## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme <orig>نظام الاستثمار الجماعي</orig> shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus <orig>نشرة الاكتتاب</orig>.
## Article Four
The marketing license <orig>رخصة التسويق</orig> shall be valid for one year, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.
## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be deemed null and void.
## Article Six
The competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

# Insurance Regulatory Unit
## Resolution No. (18) of 2025
Regarding the Issuance of Rules for Compliance with Professional Ethics, Competence, and Integrity for Licensed Persons
Chairman of the Supreme Committee of the Insurance Regulatory Unit
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance and its Executive Regulations and amendments thereto,
- And Law No. (1) of 2016 issuing the Companies Law and its amendments,
- And Resolution No. (58) of 2023 regarding the issuance of Corporate Governance Rules and its amendments,
- And Resolution No. (12) of 2025 regarding the conditions required for registrable positions,
- And Resolution No. (13) of 2025 regarding the conditions required for registrable positions (Independent Board Member)
- And based on the decision of the Supreme Committee at its meeting No. (7) of 2025 dated 06-08-2025.
- And based on the public interest.
Has decided the following:
### Article One
The rules for compliance with professional ethics, competence, and integrity for licensed persons shall be implemented in accordance with what is stated in Annex No. (1) of this Resolution.
### Article Two
The rules for compliance with professional ethics, competence, and integrity for licensed persons, as contained in Annex No. (1) of this Resolution, shall apply to all those subject to the provisions of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance and its Executive Regulations and amendments thereto.
### Article Three
Violation of this Resolution shall result in the legal liability stipulated in Law No. (125) of 2019 and its Executive Regulations and amendments thereto, without prejudice to other relevant laws.
### Article Four
The rules for compliance with professional ethics, competence, and integrity for licensed persons shall come into effect from 01/01/2026 and shall be published in the Official Gazette. The competent authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

# Chapter One: Definitions
## Article One
### Definitions
The words and phrases contained in these Rules shall have the same meanings as those stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations and their amendments, and shall be considered an integral part of these Rules. Furthermore, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated next to each, unless the context requires otherwise:
1.  **The Law**: Law No. 125 of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig> and its amendments.
2.  **Executive Regulations**: The Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> and their amendments, which were established pursuant to the Unit's Law.
3.  **Decisions**: These are the decisions issued by the Unit.
4.  **The Unit**: Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
5.  **The Rules**: Rules of Adherence to Professional Ethics, Competence, and Integrity for Licensed Persons.
6.  **Those Subject to the Rules**: Insurance and reinsurance companies (conventional and Takaful) and all insurance professions subject to Law No. (125) of 2019 and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
7.  **Internal Regulations**: These are the internal policies, procedures, work, systems, and controls for adhering to professional ethics, competence, and integrity for all those subject to the provisions of Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations and their amendments, and the decisions and circulars issued thereunder.
8.  **Professional Ethics**: These are the sound conduct, principles, and ethics practiced by employees of the licensed person at all their job levels, which include honesty, truthfulness, respect for others, commitment to information confidentiality, and safeguarding the interests of their employer, clients, beneficiaries, and the public interest.
9.  **Competence**: It is the ability of an employee in any position and job level to perform their job duties to the fullest extent according to their academic, professional, specialized, and technical qualifications.
10. **Integrity**: It is the good reputation, sound conduct, and financial soundness that must be present among the employees of the licensed person at all their positions and job levels, ensuring no conflict of interest.
11. **Senior Executive Management**: A group of individuals appointed by the Board of Directors to manage the company on a daily basis in accordance with the strategies, policies, and procedures set by the Board of Directors, and they are responsible for overseeing the company's management.
12. **Registrable Positions**: These are the executive positions and their equivalents for licensed companies, for which the occupant must be registered with the Unit according to the conditions and procedures issued by the Unit in this regard and before commencing their duties.
13. **Registrable Offices**: This is the office of an independent board member, for which the occupant must be registered with the Unit according to the conditions and procedures issued by the Unit in this regard and before commencing their duties.
14. **Insider**: It is a natural or legal person who, by virtue of their position, has access to material information or data that was not available to the public about one of the entities subject to the Unit.
15. **Violations**: Any act or omission that leads to a breach of the obligations, controls, systems, or conditions stipulated in Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig>, its Executive Regulations and their amendments, or these Rules, decisions, and circulars issued thereunder, shall be considered a violation.

# Chapter Two: Internal Regulations, Professional Ethics, Practice, Competence, and Integrity
## Article Two
### Internal Regulations
Those subject to the Rules must have their Internal Regulations approved by their Board of Directors, in a manner commensurate with the size and nature of the institution, and in compliance with the Unit's Law, its Executive Regulations and their amendments, relevant decisions and rules, and the scope of its operations. These regulations shall apply to all local and foreign branches and group subsidiaries, if any, provided that they are updated every two years or based on the Unit's decisions. Those subject to the Rules must verify that foreign branches and subsidiaries implement the requirements contained in the Rules to the extent permitted by the local laws of the host country. In the event that the laws of the host country do not fully permit the application of the requirements mentioned in the preceding article, those subject to the Rules shall implement appropriate measures for the requirements and include this in the Internal Regulations, while notifying the Unit accordingly.

## Article Three
### Responsibility for Applying the Rules
The Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig> or their equivalent shall be responsible for applying these Rules. They may assign one of the senior executives, managers, or their equivalents, who are relevant, to apply these Rules, provided that the annual report is submitted to the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>. In all cases, the annual report must be approved by the Board of Directors or its equivalent, and the annual report shall be submitted to the Unit upon request.

# Article Six
## Competence and Integrity

Those subject to these rules must:
1. Ensure the recruitment of competent individuals based on their academic, professional, specialized, and technical qualifications, along with a good reputation, sound conduct, and financial integrity for the job candidate.
2. A criminal record certificate must be submitted from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, indicating the absence of final, definitive judgments that violate honor and trust.
3. In cases of foreign employees, a certificate of no judicial judgments violating honor and trust must be submitted, issued by the foreign employee's country and attested by the Embassy of the State of Kuwait <orig>سفارة دولة الكويت</orig> in that country.
4. Holders of leadership positions and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must inform the employer or the unit if a judgment declaring their bankruptcy is issued or if a decision to imprison them for a debt is issued.

# Article Seven
## Obligations of Those Subject to the Rules Before and During Contracting

The subject party must adhere to the following:
**First**: Before Contracting:
1. Deal according to insurance principles, especially the principle of utmost good faith, and adopt the principle of disclosure and transparency.
2. Fully understand and know the client's needs.
3. Provide appropriate advice to clients according to their needs and offer suitable alternatives.
4. Ensure that products offered to clients include all coverage details, terms, and exclusions.
5. Provide clear information to insurance applicants, insured parties, and beneficiaries, and give the client a full and comprehensive explanation to clarify the procedures for submitting and following up on claims.
6. During the validity of the contract (policy): (Excluding reinsurers and insurance brokers).
7. Inform the client of any updates or changes affecting the policy terms and the insurance premium value, stating the reasons.
8. Provide the client with an official or electronic letter confirming the company's receipt of the claim, including all documents submitted by the client, and that a specific claim number is registered therein, as well as an official or electronic letter confirming the company's receipt if the client submits additional documents.
9. Notify the client with an official or electronic letter of the acceptance or rejection of the claim, including all its main details, within the period specified by law or the unit's decisions from the date the company completes the claim file, and in case of

# Article Four
## Professional Ethics

Those subject to these rules must:
1. Oblige their employees to uphold the highest degrees of honesty, truthfulness, and respect for others, commit to information confidentiality, and prioritize the public interest, the interest of their employer, their clients, and beneficiaries.
2. Fairness and non-discrimination, treating all clients and beneficiaries with justice and equality without any distinction or bias for any reason whatsoever.
3. Oblige all employees to sign a declaration and undertaking confirming their awareness of the internal regulations.
4. Establish a clear policy for protecting whistleblowers to senior executive management and regulatory bodies.
In all cases, the subject party must prepare a special register for complaints submitted by clients, and a special register for complaints submitted by employees, detailing the complaint and its final outcome. Also, a special register for penalties, detailing the employee's violation and the prescribed penalty, to be submitted to the unit upon request.

# Article Five
## Professional Practice

**First**: Services provided to the public must be:
1. Clear, whether printed, audio, or visual.
2. Services must be provided in Arabic clearly and in a legible font, not in small letters. Services must also be provided in English if requested by the client.
3. Highlight important clauses in documents and papers provided to clients with a different color or font, clearly visible to the client.
4. Ensure all clauses are explained before the client signs, especially concerning products that include complex detailed and technical clauses.
5. Commit to providing high-quality service and prioritize the client's interest, without exploiting their ignorance or need.
**Second**: Employees of those subject to these rules must have:
1. A suitable working and training environment, and a commitment to raising the level of professional, specialized, and technical achievement of employees.
2. A special register for courses provided to employees, to be submitted to the unit upon request.
3. Ensure that relevant employees have full knowledge of the details of products offered by the company to ensure their complete explanation to the public and clients.

5. No cancellation by either party shall be valid unless notification is made through a written letter delivered to the other party or through one of the approved electronic means.
6. The insurer shall, within a period not exceeding (5) working days from the date of the competent authority's approval of the policy cancellation, refund any remaining part of the insurance premium / subscription – if any – to the insured / subscriber. The insured / subscriber shall not be entitled to any refund amount if there is any claim related to the policy, whether paid or under settlement, or if the delay is due to negligence or default, unless the excuse is acceptable.
In all cases, the insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> is obligated to notify the insured / subscriber of the outcome of the procedures mentioned above.

### Article Eight
Cash transactions are prohibited under any circumstances. The collection of the value of compulsory insurance policies, the payment of commissions to the insurance broker <orig>وسيط التأمين</orig> or insurance agent <orig>وكيل التأمين</orig>, and the payment of compensation shall only be made through electronic payment methods, bank transfers, or checks.

### Article Nine
The insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig>, when reviewing a claim file submitted to it, has the right to inquire from the claimant about the existence of any other insurance policies with coverage for the same compensation. To this end, it may oblige the claimant to submit a declaration stating that they have not received any compensation or that there is no other coverage for the same compensation.
In the event that the claimant declares the existence of coverage from another insurance company, the insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> has the right to request a certificate issued by the other insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة الأخرى</orig> stating that no compensation has been paid by it for the same claim, all without obliging any party to pay fees or amounts for this certificate.

### Article Ten
No exceptions, conditions, liabilities, or deductibles on compulsory insurance policies that lead to the cancellation of the policy from its intended purpose shall be recognized, and insuring companies <orig>الشركات المؤمنة</orig> are not permitted to apply any of them to the aforementioned policies.

### Article Eleven
No additional fees or amounts, regardless of their designation, may be applied for receiving or settling a claim. Insuring companies <orig>الشركات المؤمنة</orig> – under compulsory insurance policies – are obligated to settle any claim immediately upon receipt.

### Article Twelve
Insuring companies <orig>الشركات المؤمنة</orig> are obligated to provide insurance coverage and meet the required conditions according to the rules regulated by the competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> – for each compulsory policy separately – without reduction or restriction of any person's right to claim compensation due under the provisions of the policy and relevant laws.

(QR Code) indicating at least the following data (Policy Number – Policy Schedule – Sum Insured – General Conditions – Exclusions – Deductibles – Special Conditions – Premium / Subscription Amount – Insurance Broker / Agent Data – Endorsements – Coverage Period – Issue Date – Quick Response Code (QR Code) – Any other data).

### Article Five
Insuring companies <orig>الشركات المؤمنة</orig> are prohibited from issuing compulsory insurance policies without a verification code (QR Code), and the aforementioned companies are obligated to do the following:
a- Follow the principles and controls for activating the Quick Response Code for electronic documents, as stated in Annex No. (1) of this decision. These annexes are considered an integral and complementary part of this decision.
b- Add the verification code to the insurance policy (180) days after the date of publication of the decision.
c- Do not sign or stamp the verification code (QR Code).

### Article Six
A compulsory insurance policy may not be cancelled except after obtaining prior official approval from the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> or from the date of the judgment declaring the insuring company's <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> bankruptcy. In all cases, licensed companies and the insured / subscriber remain bound by the provisions of this policy regarding the obligations arising therefrom before its cancellation. The insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> is obligated to refund the premium / subscription amount to the insured / subscriber if the issuance of the compulsory policy cannot be completed for any reason, and the insuring company's <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> receipt of the said amount in this case shall be considered as a trust.

### Article Seven
#### Cancellation Provisions
All compulsory insurance policies are subject to cancellation provisions in accordance with the laws, regulations, and decisions issued by the competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> regulating such policies. Furthermore, the insuring company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig>, when issuing policies, must state the company's policy and procedures for policy cancellation and include them in the general conditions of compulsory insurance policies, along with clarifying the rights and responsibilities arising from the cancellation process for the insured and the insurer / subscriber. The insurer, upon cancellation of the policy, is obligated to do the following:
1. State the formula and method for calculating the amount due / refundable from the insurance premium / subscription to the insured upon cancellation of the policy.
2. Refund the remaining premium / subscription amount for the remaining days to the insured / subscriber without deducting fees, expenses, or compensations if the cancellation is made by the insurer, provided that the cancellation is justified.
3. Obligation to notify the insured / subscriber upon cancellation of the policy, stating the notification period in a manner that does not conflict with regulating laws, even if issued by

### Article Fourteen
Insuring companies are obligated, when issuing mandatory insurance policies, not to grant commissions exceeding 15% of the insurance premium/subscription value.

### Article Fifteen
The insuring company, when pricing the mandatory insurance policy, must ensure that the pricing (RATE) is not less than the value determined by the company's actuary or its reinsurance agreement.

### Article Sixteen
Calculation of Insurance Policy Premium / Subscription
1- The premium / subscription amount is divided on the following basis:

2- Regarding the work injury and occupational disease insurance policy, the company is obligated to calculate the workers' insurance policy premium / subscription according to the following equation:
Total Liability Limits = Total Monthly Wages * 12 Months
Total Insurance Premium / Subscription = Total Liability Limits * Pricing (RATE) + Supervision and Control Fees

### Article Seventeen
Obligations of the Insurer and the Insured
It is prohibited to issue, grant, market, or sell mandatory insurance policies for the benefit of the insured / subscriber unless the issuing company is licensed by the Unit, taking into account the following obligations:
1. Adherence to insurance coverages as stipulated in the laws regulating the policy.
2. The insuring company is obligated to issue the insurance policy to the insured / subscriber directly or through a broker or agent licensed by the Unit and linked to it by a written and valid contractual relationship covering the issuance and marketing of the insurance policy. It is not permissible to deal with any broker or agent not licensed by the Unit.
3. The insured / subscriber must notify the insuring company as quickly as possible of any amendments or material information that may arise in the policy schedule that would change the sum insured and the due premium / subscription, provided that an additional endorsement is made.
4. The insured / subscriber is obligated to send the required information to the licensed / insuring company when requesting the issuance of this type of policy.
5. The licensed / insuring company is obligated, when issuing the insurance policy and when

dealing with customers, to conduct its business in accordance with insurance principles, especially the principle of utmost good faith, adopting the principle of disclosure and transparency, providing clear and accurate information to insurance applicants, insureds / subscribers, and beneficiaries, and not adding any exclusions or burdens that would reduce the purpose and basic coverage of this policy.
6. Subject to Law No. (67) of 1980 issuing the Civil Code <orig>القانون المدني</orig> and its amendments, the insuring company is obligated to receive any claim submitted to it by the insured / subscriber or the beneficiary, and to decide on it according to the procedures and periods specified in Article No. (18) of this decision. In the event of the insuring company's refusal or abstention from opening a claim file, the insured / subscriber has the right to submit a complaint in this regard through the Unit's complaints system.
7. It is permissible to agree on additional insurance coverages not included in the mandatory insurance policy or to increase the limits of these liabilities and coverages by virtue of a separate policy or an additional endorsement in exchange for a premium / subscription agreed upon between the insurer and the insured / subscriber.
8. The duration of the insurance coverage and the validity period of the policy must be consistent with the requirements of the laws, regulations, decisions, and their amendments from the competent authority.
9. Without prejudice to the above clauses in the same Article, regarding the civil liability insurance policy arising from marine unit accidents, the company is obligated to include – at least – the following conditions in the policy:
- a- Compensation resulting from documented bodily injuries – the value agreed upon for amicable settlement or the value judicially awarded – inflicted upon any person, including passengers of the marine unit, except for those whose coverage is excluded (first-degree relatives and his employees). A person is considered a passenger if they are inside the marine unit or while entering or exiting it.
- b- Compensation resulting from documented damages or expenses incurred by third parties / affected parties due to damage or loss of their property, regardless of the number of persons whose property was damaged.

# The Claim.
3. Settlement and payment of claim amounts fairly and without any bargaining to the affected party within a maximum period of (10) working days from the date of acceptance of the claim.
4. In the event of a claim rejection, the insured company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> is obligated to provide the claimant with the reasons for rejection in writing or electronically, supported by documents and evidence backing the rejection decision.
5. The insured company <orig>الشركة المؤمنة</orig> must commit to settling claim amounts within a period not exceeding thirty days from the date of completion of all documents. In the event of the company's delay in settling the claim within the aforementioned period, it must submit to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> the reasons for the delay, and if the reasons are not acceptable to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, the company's liability shall arise in accordance with Article Nineteen of this Resolution.

### Article Nineteen
Violation by insured companies <orig>الشركات المؤمنة</orig> subject to Law No. (125) of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم (125) لسنة 2019</orig> and its executive regulations and amendments <orig>لائحته التنفيذية وتعديلاتها</orig> of this Resolution shall result in their legal liability as stipulated in the Law <orig>القانون</orig> and its executive regulations and amendments <orig>لائحته التنفيذية وتعديلاته</orig>, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

### Article Twenty
This Resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication. Any other text that contradicts its provisions shall be repealed, and all competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> shall be obligated to implement it, each within its scope of jurisdiction.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig>
Issued on: 13 August 2025 AD

## Annex No. (1) of Resolution No. (19) of 2025.
Licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخصة</orig> for issuing the policy must follow the principles and controls for activating the Quick Response Code (QR-Code) for electronic documents, which are as follows:

### First – Technical Controls for Developing Electronic Systems:
Licensed insurance companies <orig>شركات التأمين المرخصة</orig> must adhere to the following controls when developing the mechanism for issuing electronic documents and authenticating them with a Quick Response Code (QR-Code):
1. The QR-Code must be issued electronically from the company's automated system and be unique to each document.
2. Create an electronic record for each individually issued document in the automated system and link it to a QR-Code to retrieve data in real time, and allow the insured / (subscriber) / policyholder to view and monitor any changes to the document.
3. Create an electronic page to display the document record when scanning the QR-Code, including the following data (Insurance Company Name – Policy Number – Policy Validity and Expiry Status – Insurance Start Date – Insurance End Date – Names of Insured Parties) according to the following standards:
    - Use the insurance company's official domain to host the electronic page.
    - Use encrypted channels (SSL) to access the electronic page, provided that the user sees (Error! Hyperlink reference not valid.) when accessing the electronic page.
    - Use updated frameworks for programming the electronic document issuance process and QR-Code, and regularly update programming commands.

### Second – Information Security and Protection Controls:
Licensed insurance companies <orig>شركات التأمين المرخصة</orig> for issuing the policy are prohibited from using the Quick Response Code (QR-Code) in the following ways:
1. Requesting data entry from the insured / (subscriber) / policyholder after scanning the QR-Code.
2. Redirecting the insured / (subscriber) / policyholder to electronic payment gateways.
3. Using manual stickers or stamps to place the code on the policy document.
4. Downloading files when scanning the QR-Code.
5. Requesting permissions from the personal device of the insured / policyholder to complete the QR-Code scanning process.
6. Using a Barcode as an alternative to a QR-Code.

### Third – Awareness and Guidance Controls for Policy Beneficiaries:
Licensed insurance companies <orig>شركات التأمين المرخصة</orig> for issuing the policy must provide continuous awareness to the insured / policyholder and relevant parties through various media to avoid fraud and forgery attempts. It was decided as follows:

### Article One
Articles (19, 70, 182, 206, 224, 242) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 concerning the Regulation of Insurance shall be amended in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this Decision, and the remaining articles shall remain in force as they are.

### Article Two
Holders of valid individual insurance professional licenses shall be granted a grace period of (90) days from the date of publication of this Decision in the Official Gazette to regularize their status.

### Article Three
Any text that contradicts the amendments contained in Annex No. (1) of this Decision shall be repealed.

### Article Four
All competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette.

Issued on August 13, 2025
Chairman of the Supreme Committee

### Article No. (206)
Of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance

1.  The following conditions must be met for individuals to be registered as risk assessment and loss adjustment experts in the register of risk assessment and loss adjustment experts:
    *   a- Be of Kuwaiti nationality, a citizen of one of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> (GCC) states, or a foreigner with a valid residency in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
    *   b- Possess full legal capacity.
    *   c- Hold a university degree in accordance with the controls and conditions determined by the Unit.
    *   d- Have practical experience in the field of risk assessment and loss adjustment in insurance for not less than five years, and have practiced risk assessment and loss adjustment independently or with a legal entity licensed to operate in risk assessment and loss adjustment activities inside or outside the State.
    *   e- Not be a shareholder in an insurance company, a member of its board of directors, or one of its employees.
    *   f- Not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty, or of a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, unless his reputation has been restored.
    *   g- Not be held responsible, based on a judicial ruling or disciplinary decision, for a serious violation of any provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> in his capacity as a Director General <orig>مديراً عاماً</orig> or a member of the board of directors of a company, including responsibility for the compulsory liquidation of the company.
    *   h- Be an employee of a licensed insurance company or a licensed company with the relevant specialization. An individual may not work or be professionally associated with more than one company or entity at the same time.

2.  Subject to the aforementioned Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the Encouragement of Direct Foreign Investment <orig>تشجيع الاستثمار الأجنبي المباشر</orig>, the following conditions are required for the registration of risk assessment and loss adjustment experts from companies:
    *   a- The paid-up capital of the company established in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall not be less than (10,000) ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
    *   b- Its objectives shall include the activity of a risk assessment and loss adjustment expert.
    *   c- The company shall have a manager / chief executive officer who meets the conditions and qualifications stipulated in paragraph (1) of this Article.

### Article No. (224)
Of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (125) of 2019 regarding the Regulation of Insurance

1.  The following conditions are required for those to be registered in the register of insurance consultants:
    *   a- Be of Kuwaiti nationality, a citizen of one of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون الخليجي</orig> (GCC) states, or a foreigner with a valid residency in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
    *   b- Possess full legal capacity.
    *   c- Hold a university degree in accordance with the controls and conditions determined by the Unit.
    *   d- Have practical experience in the field of insurance consulting for not less than five years, and have practiced insurance consulting work or have experience in the field of insurance for not less than ten years in technical departments, with proof thereof.
    *   e- Not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty, or of a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, unless his reputation has been restored.
    *   f- Be an employee of a licensed insurance company or a licensed company

Decided
### Article (1)
The texts of Articles (1) and (5) of Resolution No. (7) of 1977 referred to shall be replaced by the following two texts:
"Article (1): The Grievance Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig> stipulated in Article (107) of the Social Insurance Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> referred to shall be formed under the chairmanship of the Head of the Public Legal Affairs Sector <orig>قطاع الشئون القانونية العامة</orig> or his deputy in his absence, and with the membership of each of the following:
- a - The Director of the General Fatwa and Legal Consultations Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والاستشارات القانونية العامة</orig> or his deputy.
- b - The Director of the competent department according to the subject of the grievance or his deputy.
- c - A legal researcher from the Public Legal Affairs Sector <orig>قطاع الشئون القانونية العامة</orig> of the institution, who shall be the rapporteur of the committee, and whose appointment shall be issued by a decision from the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>."
"Article (5): The committee shall issue its decisions by majority vote, and its meeting shall not be valid unless its full body is present. The grievant shall be notified of the committee's decision by any modern written or electronic means within a maximum of three days from the date of its issuance."
### Article (2)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

Minister of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزير الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
and Acting Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig> and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment <orig>وزير دولة للشؤون الاقتصادية والاستثمار</orig>
Dr. Subaih Abdulaziz Abdulmohsen Al-Mukhaizim <orig>د. صبيح عبدالعزيز عبدالمحسن المخيزم</orig>

Issued on: 11 August 2025 AD

# Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
## Resolution No. 165/1 - R / 2025
Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
Having reviewed Articles (21) and (61) of Law No. (32) of 1968 regarding Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession <orig>تنظيم المهنة المصرفية</orig> and its amendments.
And Articles (4), (5), and (7) of Ministerial Resolution No. (39) of 2003 regarding the Regulations of the Banks Register <orig>سجل البنوك</orig> at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
And based on the request of the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig> dated 27/7/2025 regarding the amendment of its data in the Banks Register <orig>سجل البنوك</orig> at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
Decided
### Article One
The following amendment shall be recorded in the Banks Register <orig>سجل البنوك</orig> at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> regarding the data of the subsidiaries and associates of the National Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني</orig>:
- Deletion of the subsidiary Al-Watani Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية</orig>.
### Article Two
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance.
The Governor

Issued on: 11 Safar 1447 AH
Corresponding to: 5 August 2025 AD

## Announcement

The esteemed owners of Al-Concord Al-Oula for Sanitary Ware and Maintenance Company <orig>الكنكورد الأولى للأدوات الصحية وصيانتها</orig> (Company under liquidation) submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry to carry out / dissolve and liquidate the company.
Legal Entity: One-Person Company
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

## Announcement

Submitted by: Misters / Al-Seifaq Medical and Pharmaceutical Equipment Company <orig>شركة السيفاق للتجهيزات الطبية والدوائية</orig>
a request to register an agency with the Commercial Register Department approved by the Ministry, where the agency is registered under registration number: 2025/01043.
Company and Nationality: Bloom Europe B.V. – Netherlands
The agency's activity consists of: Oral gel – Oxygen liquid – Fluoride-free toothpaste – Fluoride toothpaste – Oral foam – Mouthwash – Dental gum – Post-surgical toothbrush.
The duration shall be from: 2025/06/25 to: 2028/06/24.

a request to register an agency with the Commercial Register Department approved by the Ministry, where the agency is registered under registration number: 2025/01044.
Company and Nationality: Mislo Limited – Cyprus
The agency's activity consists of: Laboratory reagents.
The duration shall be from: 2025/07/17 to: 2027/07/16.

## Announcement

Submitted by: Misters / Boubyan Elevators, Escalators Technology and Contracting Company <orig>شركة بوبيان لتكنولوجيا المصاعد والسلالم الكهربائية ومقاولاتها</orig>
a request to register an agency with the Commercial Register Department approved by the Ministry, where the agency is registered under registration number: 2025/01039.
Company and Nationality: Brilliant Lifts Technology Limited – People's Republic of China.
The agency's activity consists of: All elevators from the "BRILLIANT LIFTS" series, including: Passenger elevators, machine-room elevators, machine-room-less elevators, home elevators, freight elevators, panoramic elevators, villa elevators, escalators, passenger conveyor belts, and their accessories.
The duration shall be from: 2025/05/20 to: 2027/05/19.

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>

## Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. P / MS / 2025/2026/32
Technical support for smartphone applications among companies and institutions specialized in this field and registered with the Central Agency for Information Technology, in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), upon payment of an amount of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, non-refundable.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower when submitting the booklet, confirming compliance with the National Labor Support Law, in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104/decisive of 2008, regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 08/09/2025, at the tenders box in the General Diwan of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Al-Sulaibikhat – Ministry of Health Building – First Floor – Procurement Department – Practices Section). Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) two percent only of the bid value, valid for the duration of the bid.
Note: Priority will be given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice can purchase and obtain the practice documents by accessing the website of the Public Authority for Youth <orig>الهيئة العامة للشباب</orig> (https://www.youth.gov.kw) for the specified fee. Bids envelopes are received from the Tenders, Contracts and Investment Department in the Financial Affairs Control (First Floor) – located at Jaber Al-Ahmad Youth Center <orig>مركز شباب جابر الأحمد</orig> in Jaber Al-Ahmad <orig>جابر الأحمد</orig> area – Plot (7) – (N3) – Street 60, during official working hours.

Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 1:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax and placed in the designated box for practices at the Authority's headquarters at Jaber Al-Ahmad Youth Center <orig>مركز شباب جابر الأحمد</orig> – First Floor. No bids received after the specified closing time for the practice will be accepted.
The participant is obligated to ensure that the bid remains valid for ninety (90) days from the closing date. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the practice documents purchase receipt, the original initial guarantee, a valid national labor support certificate issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig>, and a valid registration certificate for companies and institutions specialized in the required works registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> will be excluded.
All companies submitting bids must have their representative attend the bid opening meeting at the Public Authority for Youth <orig>الهيئة العامة للشباب</orig> on Sunday, September 7, 2025, at 2:30 PM.
Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the participants.
